docs.snippet: The Federal Communications Commission often took stances that angered the phone and cable industries under the Obama administration. It's already starting to lean the other way....
docs.lead_paragraph: The Federal Communications Commission often took stances that angered the phone and cable industries under the Obama administration. It's already starting to lean the other way.

headline.main: FCC Led by Trump Pick Starts to Reverse Obama Policies
headline.print_headline: FCC Led by Trump Pick Starts to Reverse Obama Policies

docs.snippet: The U.S. House of Representatives on Friday repealed a rule put forth in the final days of the Obama administration that limited emissions of the potent greenhouse gas methane from oil and gas drilling on federal lands, in the latest move by Repub...
docs.lead_paragraph: The U.S. House of Representatives on Friday repealed a rule put forth in the final days of the Obama administration that limited emissions of the potent greenhouse gas methane from oil and gas drilling on federal lands, in the latest move by Republican lawmakers to overturn regulation on the energy industry.

headline.main: House Repeals Obama Rule on Methane Emissions on Federal Lands
headline.print_headline: House Repeals Obama Rule on Methane Emissions on Federal Lands

docs.snippet: Senator Gordon H. Smith, a two-term Republican, was in a nip-and-tuck race with Jeff Merkley, a Democrat who is the speaker of Oregon's state house. With  79 percent of the ballots counted, Mr. Smith had fallen behind Mr. Merkley by about 9,700 vo...
docs.lead_paragraph: Senator Gordon H. Smith, a two-term Republican, was in a nip-and-tuck race with Jeff Merkley, a Democrat who is the speaker of Oregon's state house. With 79 percent of the ballots counted, Mr. Smith had fallen behind Mr. Merkley by about 9,700 votes. Mr. Merkley has been counting on a statewide surge in voter registration among Democrats spurred by the campaign of Senator Barack Obama.
docs.abstract: Oregon Senate race between incumbent Republican Gordon H Smith and Democratic challenger Jeff Merkley remains undecided; Barack Obama wins state, 56-42 percent; tallies (S)

docs.snippet: The Republican-controlled House voted on Friday to overturn an Obama administration rule that sought to reduce harmful methane emissions into the environment, part of the Democratic president's campaign to combat climate change....
docs.lead_paragraph: The Republican-controlled House voted on Friday to overturn an Obama administration rule that sought to reduce harmful methane emissions into the environment, part of the Democratic president's campaign to combat climate change.

headline.main: House Votes to Overturn Obama Rule on Natural Gas 'Flaring'
headline.print_headline: House Votes to Overturn Obama Rule on Natural Gas 'Flaring'

docs.snippet: Politics | So how did a liberal Obama get along with fellow faculty at the "famously conservative" University of Chicago Law School? One former dean says, "He's much more intellectual, much more thoughtful, much more interested in discussion, deba...
docs.lead_paragraph: Politics | So how did a liberal Obama get along with fellow faculty at the "famously conservative" University of Chicago Law School? One former dean says, "He's much more intellectual, much more thoughtful, much more interested in discussion, debate, and dialogue than the typical politician even though from my perspective he's much too liberal." Still, he might vote for the guy. [New Republic]

docs.snippet: No longer will New England have a Republican in the House of Representatives.     Christopher Shays of Connecticut, the lone conservative in a region long dyed blue, suffered a startling defeat to a Democratic businessman from Greenwich, Jim Himes...
docs.lead_paragraph: No longer will New England have a Republican in the House of Representatives. Christopher Shays of Connecticut, the lone conservative in a region long dyed blue, suffered a startling defeat to a Democratic businessman from Greenwich, Jim Himes.
docs.abstract: Democrat Jim Hines defeats incumbent Republican Rep Christopher Shays in Connecticut House race; Democratic incumbents John B Larson, Joe Courtney, Rosa DeLauro and Christopher S Murphy win re-election; Barack Obama wins state, 60-39 percent (M)

docs.snippet: Senator Barack Obama easily carried Iowa, the state where his presidential ambitions took flight with his success in the Democratic caucuses in January. He received more votes on Tuesday than any presidential candidate in the state's history.     ...
docs.lead_paragraph: Senator Barack Obama easily carried Iowa, the state where his presidential ambitions took flight with his success in the Democratic caucuses in January. He received more votes on Tuesday than any presidential candidate in the state's history. Senator John McCain had alienated some voters with his outspoken criticism of agricultural subsidies, especially those for ethanol.
docs.abstract: Iowa Sen Tom Harkin retains his seat, defeating challenge by Republican Christopher Reed; in Congressional election, incumbent Democrats Dave Loebsack, Bruce Braley and Leonard L Boswell and Republicans Steve King and Tom Latham retain their seats; Barack Obama wins state, 54-45 percent; tallies (S)

docs.snippet: In just a generation, Maryland has turned from a longtime swing state -- George Bush won there in 1988 -- to a solid blue swatch on the national map, and it is more Democratic than ever this year.     Democrats appear to have taken a Republican-he...
docs.lead_paragraph: In just a generation, Maryland has turned from a longtime swing state -- George Bush won there in 1988 -- to a solid blue swatch on the national map, and it is more Democratic than ever this year. Democrats appear to have taken a Republican-held House seat, giving them seven of Maryland's eight districts.
docs.abstract: Democrat Frank M Kratovil Jr leads Republican Andy Harris in tight race for Maryland Congressional seat; Barack Obama wins state, 61-38 percent; tally (S)
